poem:
Title: Votives to the Veiled Oracle

A clash of shields, behind hospital ranks,
Junior doctors, standing like Spartan branks.
Voting with heartbeats, striking a tone,
A voice for the voiceless, marrow to bone. 

August summer scales, tipped in favour,
Justice in dispute, they savour.
Their stethoscope silence, ringing until,
Mid-September's surrender, or government ill.

A shared pulse, a resolute hymn,
NHS's hope, on a protest's rim.
